chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
L: Language

Goal:
forall (l : list nat) (f1 f2 : nat -> fol.Term L), (forall m : nat, In m l -> f1 m = f2 m) -> freeVarMap l f1 = freeVarMap l f2

Premises:
Module fol := Struct Record Language : Type := language { Relations : Set; Functions : Set; arity : Relations + Functions -> nat } Definition Relations : Language -> Set. Definition Functions : Language -> Set. Definition arity : forall l : Language, Relations l + Functions l -> nat. Inductive Term (L : Language) : Set := var : nat -> Term L | apply : forall f : Functions L, Terms L (arity L (inr f)) -> Term L with Terms (L : Language) : nat -> Set := Tnil : Terms L 0 | Tcons : forall n : nat, Term L -> Terms L n -> Terms L (S n) Definition Term_rect : forall (L : Language) (P : Term L -> Type), (forall n : nat, P (var L n)) -> (forall (f0 : Functions L) (t : Terms L (arity L (inr f0))), P (apply
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
freeVarMap = fix freeVarMap (l : list nat) : (nat -> fol.Term L) -> list nat := match l with | nil => fun _ : nat -> fol.Term L => nil | a :: l' => fun m : nat -> fol.Term L => freeVarTerm L (m a) ++ freeVarMap l' m end : list nat -> (nat -> fol.Term L) -> list nat Arguments freeVarMap _%list_scope _%function_scope
reduceCloseList : forall (L : Language) (l : list nat) (f1 f2 : fol.Formula L) (T : fol.System L), (forall v : nat, In v l -> ~ In_freeVarSys L v T) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f1 f2) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L (closeList L l f1) (closeList L l f2))
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
app_assoc_reverse : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), (l ++ m) ++ n = l ++ m ++ n
subAllTerm_ext : forall (t : fol.Term L) (m1 m2 : nat -> fol.Term L), (forall m : nat, In m (freeVarTerm L t) -> m1 m = m2 m) -> subAllTerm t m1 = subAllTerm t m2
subAllTerms_ext : forall (n : nat) (ts : fol.Terms L n) (m1 m2 : nat -> fol.Term L), (forall m : nat, In m (freeVarTerms L n ts) -> m1 m = m2 m) -> subAllTerms n ts m1 = subAllTerms n ts m2
subFormulaImp : forall (L : Language) (f1 f2 : fol.Formula L) (v : nat) (s : fol.Term L), substituteFormula L (fol.impH L f1 f2) v s = fol.impH L (substituteFormula L f1 v s) (substituteFormula L f2 v s)
reduceImp : forall (L : Language) (f1 f2 f3 f4 : fol.Formula L) (T : fol.System L), folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f1 f3) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f2 f4) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L (fol.impH L f1 f2) (fol.impH L f3 f4))
reduceIff : forall (L : Language) (f1 f2 f3 f4 : fol.Formula L) (T : fol.System L), folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f1 f3) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f2 f4) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L (fol.iffH L f1 f2) (fol.iffH L f3 f4))
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
list_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Set), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
newVar2 : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), In n l -> n < newVar l
freeVarClosedList1 : forall (L : Language) (l : list nat) (v : nat) (x : fol.Formula L), In v l -> ~ In v (freeVarFormula L (closeList L l x))
reduceNot : forall (L : Language) (f1 f2 : fol.Formula L) (T : fol.System L), folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f1 f2) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L (fol.notH L f1) (fol.notH L f2))
reduceForall : forall (L : Language) (f1 f2 : fol.Formula L) (v : nat) (T : fol.System L), ~ In_freeVarSys L v T -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L f1 f2) -> folProof.SysPrf L T (fol.iffH L (fol.forallH L v f1) (fol.forallH L v f2))
Relations = fun l : Language => let (Relations, Functions, _) := l in Relations : Language -> Set
Functions = fun l : Language => let (Relations, Functions, _) := l in Functions : Language -> Set
freeVarClosedList2 : forall (L : Language) (l : list nat) (v : nat) (x : fol.Formula L), In v (freeVarFormula L (closeList L l x)) -> In v (freeVarFormula L x)
le_lt_or_eq : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n < m \/ n = m
arity : forall l : Language, Relations l + Functions l -> nat
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
newVar1 : forall l : list nat, ~ In (newVar l) l
plus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, S (n + m) = n + S m
Nat.add_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n + S m = S (n + m)
In_list_remove3 : forall (A : Set) (Aeq_dec : forall a b : A, {a = b} + {a <> b}) (a b : A) (l : list A), In a l -> a <> b -> In a (list_remove A Aeq_dec b l)
no_dup1 : forall (A : Set) (Aeq_dec : forall a b : A, {a = b} + {a <> b}) (a : A) (l : list A), In a l -> In a (no_dup A Aeq_dec l)
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
subAllTerm = fix subAllTerm (t : fol.Term L) : (nat -> fol.Term L) -> fol.Term L := match t with | @fol.var _ x => fun m : nat -> fol.Term L => m x | @fol.apply _ f ts => fun m : nat -> fol.Term L => fol.apply L f (subAllTerms (arity L (inr f)) ts m) end with subAllTerms (n : nat) (ts : fol.Terms L n) {struct ts} : (nat -> fol.Term L) -> fol.Terms L n := match ts in (fol.Terms _ n0) return ((nat -> fol.Term L) -> fol.Terms L n0) with | @Tnil _ => fun _ : nat -> fol.Term L => Tnil L | @Tcons _ n' t ss => fun m : nat ->...-> fol.Term L Arguments subAllTerm _ _%function_scope
